column4: i have a Canon MX860 printer that i want to use through the network.  there is no pdd file on the CD and i cant find one online, does anyone know how to get the postscript file for this printer? or where to find a linux driver for this?
did you check linuxprinting ?
the openprinting site?
yes
if the pdd isn't on this website, it's going to be difficult to find one...
my printer isn't even listed on this site, illovae
whoaou...
it lists the model just before my model, it liss the 850 but not the 860
maybe you can try with the 850's pdd, it might work... The canon website doesn't give you the pdd for your model I guess ?
the canon site doesnt give anything but the .exe files, and there is no pdd on the CD
maybe you can try to extract the content of the .exe with cabextract if it work on it
or you can try to install the .exe on a windows partition and check the installed files
i'll try that, then i'll try the 850's pdd, and if that doesnt work then i'll return the printer and get an HP or something
yeah ^^'
if you can return the printer, it's a good idea I think... You know Canon and gnu/linux are not friends
blame my folks, they wanted the canon.
arf, I can understand that :}
if cabextract doesn't work, you can use wine to install the .exe in your ~/.wine folder ; you'll find the installed files easier than on a windows partition ;)
i already tried that but it needs the printer to be plugged in via usb, and the printer is in another room and i was lazy :P
ouarf, the .exe need the printer to be plugged !!! yiark
well, I suppose cabextract won't work then...
im using it right now, havent found anything yet tho
yep... the 'windows partition' solution is the best way I think, anyway goodluck =)
